industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Who is Innovapost?


Great question! We are the technology arm of the Canada Post Group of companies. This includes Canada Post, Purolator, and SCI. By joining us you will be able to make a positive impact on how every Canadian deliver and receives their packages and mail. Next time you see your neighbor picking up their mail and receiving a package, you will be able to say “you’re welcome!”


What role will you play?


Reporting to the CITO Group Head, the Solution Integration Architect (“SIA”) provides overarching architecture direction for the entire business solution delivery team and the strategic projects. The Solution Integration Architect provides technical leadership to business partners and internal stakeholders regarding the integration of systems, software, and processes. The SIA ensures solutions meet business needs along with architecturally significant functional and non-functional requirements. The Solution Integration Architect is a senior role in the architecture family. The SIA works with the Business Solution Delivery Lead and the Enterprise Architecture team to define multi-year technology roadmaps. In collaboration with solution architects, this individual initiates the architecture blueprints that establish the specific standards and patterns that will be used by development teams.

In addition, the SIA will be the point of contact for the enterprise view of the Obsolescence Risk Management and working with the SIA across the enterprise to establish a roadmap for business applications to avoid obsolete system components.

CPG technical environment is very diverse with SAP at its core plus over 400 custom applications supporting the business operations. The infrastructure includes private and vendor cloud environments, with a large data centre footprint.


What will you be responsible for? (Apart from Innovating)



Provide leadership in the logical and physical system design, and ensure design is consistent and well integrated with existing conceptual, logical, and physical architectures, in collaboration with the Business Domain Architect

Collaborate with Architecture COE on the solution design to ensure it complies with enterprise architectural standards and roadmaps and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture to ensure alignment on future roadmaps and IT Strategies

Facilitate and enable the integration of applications, services and business processes using common methodologies

Provide architectural oversight on all Internal IT (investment) projects that enhance Innovapost IT practices and/or employee experiences

Provide career and professional guidance to the assigned team of two Solution Architects.

Develop an end-to-end solution architecture that accurately translates business requirements to technology and ensures the design will meet business requirements throughout the lifecycle of a change




Additional Responsibilities




Develop, maintain, and communicate processes and standard practices related to the design, development, and implementation of application solutions on a project basis

Develop, maintain, and communicate Obsolescence Risk Management process and standard practices to keep a clear view of the system software support roadmaps and the impact on the applications across the enterprise. 

Participate in tier 3 application support activities including incident management and the assessment and delivery of application upgrades and patches

Analyze and estimate feasibility, costs, time, and resources needed to develop and implement solutions (high level)

In collaboration with the Enterprise Architect and the Architecture COE, research and evaluate software technology, products, and solutions, and make recommendations on technology/production introduction, phase-out and retirement

Assist in application portfolio management, standards development, maintenance and governance

Work across the CPGC to understand and leverage common solution components where appropriate



What skills do you need for this role to be yours?



Client Management: can consolidate business requirements and translate them into solution architecture

Architecture design: experienced in several technology architecture design or re-design efforts

Solution design: familiar with workflow concepts and how they integrate with application solutions in a cross applications context

Value Management: can identify the effectiveness and completeness of business and technology strategies and ensure alignment with clients and other applicable cross-organization strategies

Domain knowledge: experience in relevant IT domain and business domain

Minimum of 3 or more years' experience as a Solution Integration Architect or equivalent role at a major company

Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Solution, Business, or Data Architect.

Minimum 10 years’ experience in progressively advancing roles within IT.




Additional Skills That Set You Apart




A mature perspective on architecture and its role in a dynamic company

Broad knowledge of existing technologies and interest in emerging trends and innovations

Exceptional interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation



Education



Academic: undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, business, or equivalent (required), Graduate degree in Business Administration (MBA)(Asset)



Competencies


Be Courageous

Innovate

Be Inclusive

Inspire

Be Curious

Technical Knowledge

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
First Derivative is a leading provider of products and consulting services to the capital markets industry, with over 2700 staff globally. First Derivatives (FD) is a provider of regulatory and IT consulting services to the capital markets industry as well as high-performance time series database software. The combined proposition gives FD a differentiated offering within capital markets, an industry increasingly challenged by regulation and data management. Additionally, FD has begun to establish itself in a number of industries outside of capital markets.


 


Java Architect


 


Responsibilities:


· 
Lead design, development, and deployment of technical and application solutions to meet business requirements that are cost effective and sustainable.


· 
Deliver conceptual, logical, and physical solution specifications


· 
Translate business requirements using complex methods and models to determine appropriate system solutions


· 
Provide design and implementation guidance to project teams on diverse topics including cloud-native java spring boot applications, functional and technology alternatives, methodologies, implementation tools etc.


· 
Review detailed designs created by software engineers to ensure architectural principles are adhered to, requirements are satisfied, and the solution is well tuned for a high-volume environment


· 
Champion solutions and present to enterprise review boards for implementation approval.


· 
Establish and implement technology migration strategies for a specific application or architecture within an IT portfolio that includes but not limited to vendor-hosted solutions


 


Requirement:


· 
Extensive proven experience as a Java Architect. Must be able to build solutions for Enterprise based systems.


· 
10+ years Development experience with Java, JEE (Expert)


· 
3+ Years Spring, MVC, Spring boot or similar Framework, Proficiency in various Java frameworks, libraries and frameworks 3+ years of working experience in public cloud like GCP/AWS/Azure and implementing cloud native application using docker/containers and Kubernetes.


· 
Exposure to Big Data, Cloud enablement, TOGAF, DB Architecture


· 
Strong experience in building high performance, scalable, cloud-native applications.


· 
Experience integrating web service calls and/or RESTful APIs.


 


Who are we?


 


FD Technologies plc (FD) is a leading software and services company, with world-leading intellectual property in ultra-high-performance analytics (KX) across industries, and extensive domain expertise and capabilities in capital markets systems and technology (managed

services and consulting).


 


KX:

KX technology is designed to capture and analyze data to make real-time decisions in a world where data volumes generated by markets and machines are increasing exponentially, and existing technologies fail due to technological or commercial limitations.


 


KX is widely adopted throughout the financial industry and is poised for accelerated growth across high-tech manufacturing, automotive, oil and gas, utilities, and telecommunications.


 


First Derivative:

First Derivative provides a range of managed services and consulting worldwide to its clients in the capital markets sector, including many of the world’s leading banks, focused on supporting

mission-critical systems as well as helping them to achieve and maintain regulatory compliance.

job_title: Manager, HR Data Solutions / Chef de service – Solutions – Données RH
industries: Airlines and Aviation
description:
Manager, HR Data Solutions





We are looking for talented Software Engineers/Architects to help build high impact products. Responsibilities for this position include designing, testing, implementing, releasing, mentoring other developers and supporting features that enable HR teams to create a great experience for Air Canada's Employees worldwide.

The Manager, HR Data Solutions - will play a key role within the team acting as the leading technical expert; they will be responsible of the translation of business strategies and requirements into specific technical solutions, and will have a hands-on approach in the development phase.





Primary Responsibility:





1. Act as a tech lead in the team

2. Evolve the secondary system of records outside PeopleSoft (Primary system of records).

3. Lead the HR Digital vision of the line Director and ensure compliance to delivery standards.

1. Lead HR automation initiatives with internal development.

4. Ensure solution and data framework consistency.

5. Work with Functional Architect and Experience Manage to ensure consistent employee and HR Manager experience.

6. Own data integration with PeopleSoft / Primary System of records.





Job Functions:





7. 25% Application architecture – responsible for creation on secondary system of records outside PeopleSoft

8. 25% Code review

1. Enforce coding best practices and framework adherence

2. Change Management

3. Migration policy and Automation

9. 50% Hands on programming





Qualifications:





• A depth of knowledge across multiple technologies, both Front End (JavaScript, Angular JS, JQuery, Blazor) and Back End (C#, SQL, ASP.NET, .NET Core, MVC Framework)

• Demonstrable ability to act as a technical lead on projects

• Passion for mentoring and coaching junior developers

• Experience in architecting & building web applications (both customer-facing & enterprise)

• Proficiency in Git

• Strong understanding of data structures and design patterns

• High personal standards around software development practices and craft (clean code)

• Experience in web application security best practices

• You know what a good API looks like

• You have experience with continuous integration environments, writing testable software, and test driven development

• Experience with microservices an asset

• Experience with Azure DevOps an asset"

• 
Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required






Please refer to the Air Canada Careers page for full job details.









Chef de service – Solutions – Données RH





Nous sommes à la recherche d’ingénieurs – Logiciel et d’architectes – Logiciel de talent pour nous aider à concevoir des produits qui auront une forte incidence. Les responsabilités de ce poste comprennent notamment des tâches de conception, de mise à l’essai, de mise en œuvre, de déploiement, de mentorat d’autres développeurs et de soutien visant à aider les équipes des Ressources humaines à offrir une expérience exceptionnelle aux employés d’Air Canada à l’échelle mondiale.

Le chef de service – Solutions – Données RH devra jouer un rôle essentiel au sein de l’équipe; agir à titre d’expert technique principal; traduire les stratégies et les exigences opérationnelles en solutions techniques bien précises; et adopter une approche pratique pendant la phase de développement.





Principales responsabilités:





1. Agir à titre de chef technique au sein de l’équipe.

2. Faire évoluer le système de gestion des dossiers secondaire à l’extérieur de PeopleSoft (le principal système de gestion des dossiers).

3. Diriger la stratégie numérique des RH du directeur – Données et Expérience RH et s’assurer que les normes de prestation sont respectées.

1. Diriger des initiatives d’automatisation pour favoriser le développement interne.

4. Assurer l’uniformité des solutions et du cadre des données.

5. Collaborer avec le chef de service – Fonctionnalités RH et architecte – Données pour assurer l’uniformité avec l’expérience des employés et des chefs des Ressources humaines.

6. Faciliter l’intégration des données dans PeopleSoft et le principal système de gestion des dossiers.





Tâches liées au poste:





7. 25 % : Développer l’architecture des applications – responsable de la création d’un système de gestion des dossiers secondaire à l’extérieur de PeopleSoft

8. 25 % : Examiner le code

1. Application des meilleures pratiques de codage et respect du cadre

2. Gestion du changement

3. Politique sur la migration et automatisation

9. 50 % : Faire de la programmation





Qualifications:





• Connaissances approfondies de plusieurs technologies frontales (JavaScript, AngularJS, jQuery, Blazor) et dorsales (C#, SQL, ASP.NET, .NET Core, cadre de codage MVC)

• Capacité démontrée à agir à titre de chef technique dans le cadre de projets

• Passion pour le mentorat et l’encadrement d’assistants-développeurs

• Expérience dans l’architecture et le développement d’applications Web (pour les clients et l’entreprise)

• Maîtrise de Git

• Excellente compréhension des structures de données et des modèles de conception

• Solide éthique de travail en lien avec les pratiques de développement de logiciels et le métier (code clair)

• Expérience des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité pour les applications Web

• Vous savez à quoi ressemble une bonne interface de protocole d’application (API)

• Vous avez de l’expérience dans un environnement d’intégration continue; du développement de logiciels à tester; et du développement axé sur les essais

• Expérience des microservices, un atout

• Expérience d’Azure DevOps, un atout

• 
Vaccination contre la COVID-19 requise






Veuillez consulter la page carrières d'Air Canada pour connaître tous les détails du poste.

job_title: Concepteur d'architecture d'applications - Architecte de données
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
503102BR


Introduction


Comme concepteur d'applications IBM, vous aidez directement les clients à transformer leur entreprise et à résoudre des problèmes complexes. Vous définirez la portée et la vision des projets qui offrent des solutions personnalisées en utilisant votre connaissance des plateformes IBM. Vous êtes un chef technique, qui fait la liaison entre les partenaires commerciaux, les ressources techniques et les intervenants d'un projet.

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

Le rôle du Concepteur d'architecture d'applications - Plateforme de données, Informatique cognitive et Analytique est dans le groupe-conseil IA et analytique évoluée. Ce poste nécessite une solide expérience et un succès documenté avec l'ensemble d'outils SAMM Azure, y compris Azure Kubernetes Systems (AKS). Il s'agit d'un poste qui associe de solides communications verbales et écrites dans un environnement qui évolue rapidement pour produire des résultats en utilisant le cadriciel SAFe Agile.


Principales Responsabilités




Accompagner les déploiements de jeu de représentations développés vers des environnements supérieurs.

Gérer les activités liées à Azure File and Sync et Azure Stack.

Effectuer le montage, la configuration et les déploiements à l'aide de l'ensemble d'outils Azure.

Analyser et améliorer les technologies d'encodage sous-jacentes et le montage existant.

Évaluer et analyser l'infrastructure existante et la configuration de réseau.

Fournir des rapports et des conseils concernant les mesures liées aux mises à niveau, aux améliorations ou aux nouvelles initiatives.

Gérer et organiser les tâches et les priorités sous une pression importante.

Produire des résultats de haute qualité avec une attention aux détails.

Capacité à travailler efficacement sous pression dans des situations urgentes et à hiérarchiser de multiples projets avec des délais similaires.

Documenter les processus et développer des présentations qui animent les communications internes et externes.

Soutenir les discussions techniques avec divers groupes de développeurs, de propriétaires de produit et d'expertes du domaine de service de soutien.

Apprendre de nouvelles technologies, cadriciels, outils à code source ouvert et langages de développement.



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



12 ans de mise en œuvre / support de déploiements dans des environnements supérieurs et inférieurs.

6 ans au service de la création d'environnements et de l'administration d'intergiciels

5 ans avec les technologies de virtualisation de tous les fournisseurs

3 ans en tant que concepteur d'architecture de nuage / administrateur d'intergiciels

3 ans avec l'encodage (Batch, Bash, PowerShell, Python, autre)

2 ans en maintenance de nuage, essais, mise en place et service de soutien de la production de multiplateformes

1 an avec la plateforme SAMM Azure, notamment l'image machine, le réseautique, l'équilibrage de la charge, la reprise après sinistre informatique et les composants de mémoire.

1 an d'expérience de l'utilisation de l'interpréteur de ligne de commande Azure, Storage Explorer, générant des signatures d'accès partagé pour les objets Azure Blob.

1 an allocation de ressources / configuration Azure SQL DB, Azure Monitoring, enregistrement d'applications dans Azure AD, zones de système de nom de domaine dans Azure, Azure Key vault

Expérience avec le langage XML et JSON

Connaissances de l'architecture, de la conception et de l'ingénierie système de systèmes d'entreprise utilisant les méthodologies et les cadres de référence d'architecture d'entreprise, d'ITSM, de modulation de phase, d'amélioration des processus et de maturité

« Si vous présentez votre candidature au rôle basé au Québec, vous confirmez que vous parlez couramment la langue française à l'oral et à l'écrit. »



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié



Diplôme de maîtrise en finance, statistiques, mathématiques, ingénierie ou domaines cours STEM connexes

Expérience de travail avec le cadriciel SAFe Agile

Au moins 1 an d'expérience avec le composant intégration d'application Informatica IICS.

Expérience dans la réalisation de projets de services-conseils complexes

Expérience de travail avec des clients gouvernementaux, étatiques / provinciaux et locaux



Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Consulting est l'activité de conseil et de services professionnels mondiaux d'IBM, avec des capacités de pointe dans la transformation des entreprises et des technologies. Avec une expertise approfondie dans de nombreux secteurs, nous offrons des services de stratégie, d'expérience, de technologie et d'exploitation à un grand nombre des entreprises les plus innovantes et les plus précieuses du monde. Nos collaborateurs se concentrent sur l'accélération des activités de nos clients grâce au pouvoir de la collaboration. Nous croyons au pouvoir de la technologie utilisée de manière responsable pour aider les gens, les partenaires et la planète.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Capital Markets, and Financial Services
description:
First Derivative is a leading provider of products and consulting services to the capital markets industry, with over 2700 staff globally. First Derivatives (FD) is a provider of regulatory and IT consulting services to the capital markets industry as well as high-performance time series database software. The combined proposition gives FD a differentiated offering within capital markets, an industry increasingly challenged by regulation and data management. Additionally, FD has begun to establish itself in a number of industries outside of capital markets.

 

Java Architect

 

Responsibilities:

· Lead design, development, and deployment of technical and application solutions to meet business requirements that are cost effective and sustainable.

· Deliver conceptual, logical, and physical solution specifications

· Translate business requirements using complex methods and models to determine appropriate system solutions

· Provide design and implementation guidance to project teams on diverse topics including cloud-native java spring boot applications, functional and technology alternatives, methodologies, implementation tools etc.

· Review detailed designs created by software engineers to ensure architectural principles are adhered to, requirements are satisfied, and the solution is well tuned for a high-volume environment

· Champion solutions and present to enterprise review boards for implementation approval.

· Establish and implement technology migration strategies for a specific application or architecture within an IT portfolio that includes but not limited to vendor-hosted solutions

 

Requirement:

· Extensive proven experience as a Java Architect. Must be able to build solutions for Enterprise based systems.

· 10+ years Development experience with Java, JEE (Expert)

· 3+ Years Spring, MVC, Spring boot or similar Framework, Proficiency in various Java frameworks, libraries and frameworks 3+ years of working experience in public cloud like GCP/AWS/Azure and implementing cloud native application using docker/containers and Kubernetes.

· Exposure to Big Data, Cloud enablement, TOGAF, DB Architecture

· Strong experience in building high performance, scalable, cloud-native applications.

· Experience integrating web service calls and/or RESTful APIs.

 

Who are we?

 

FD Technologies plc (FD) is a leading software and services company, with world-leading intellectual property in ultra-high-performance analytics (KX) across industries, and extensive domain expertise and capabilities in capital markets systems and technology (managed

services and consulting).

 

KX:

KX technology is designed to capture and analyze data to make real-time decisions in a world where data volumes generated by markets and machines are increasing exponentially, and existing technologies fail due to technological or commercial limitations.

 

KX is widely adopted throughout the financial industry and is poised for accelerated growth across high-tech manufacturing, automotive, oil and gas, utilities, and telecommunications.

 

First Derivative:

First Derivative provides a range of managed services and consulting worldwide to its clients in the capital markets sector, including many of the world’s leading banks, focused on supporting

mission-critical systems as well as helping them to achieve and maintain regulatory compliance.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Who is Innovapost?


Great question! We are the technology arm of the Canada Post Group of companies. This includes Canada Post, Purolator, and SCI. By joining us you will be able to make a positive impact on how every Canadian deliver and receives their packages and mail. Next time you see your neighbor picking up their mail and receiving a package, you will be able to say “you’re welcome!”


What role will you play?


Reporting to the CITO Group Head, the Solution Integration Architect (“SIA”) provides overarching architecture direction for the entire business solution delivery team and the strategic projects. The Solution Integration Architect provides technical leadership to business partners and internal stakeholders regarding the integration of systems, software, and processes. The SIA ensures solutions meet business needs along with architecturally significant functional and non-functional requirements. The Solution Integration Architect is a senior role in the architecture family. The SIA works with the Business Solution Delivery Lead and the Enterprise Architecture team to define multi-year technology roadmaps. In collaboration with solution architects, this individual initiates the architecture blueprints that establish the specific standards and patterns that will be used by development teams.

In addition, the SIA will be the point of contact for the enterprise view of the Obsolescence Risk Management and working with the SIA across the enterprise to establish a roadmap for business applications to avoid obsolete system components.

CPG technical environment is very diverse with SAP at its core plus over 400 custom applications supporting the business operations. The infrastructure includes private and vendor cloud environments, with a large data centre footprint.


What will you be responsible for? (Apart from Innovating)



Provide leadership in the logical and physical system design, and ensure design is consistent and well integrated with existing conceptual, logical, and physical architectures, in collaboration with the Business Domain Architect

Collaborate with Architecture COE on the solution design to ensure it complies with enterprise architectural standards and roadmaps and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture to ensure alignment on future roadmaps and IT Strategies

Facilitate and enable the integration of applications, services and business processes using common methodologies

Provide architectural oversight on all Internal IT (investment) projects that enhance Innovapost IT practices and/or employee experiences

Provide career and professional guidance to the assigned team of two Solution Architects.

Develop an end-to-end solution architecture that accurately translates business requirements to technology and ensures the design will meet business requirements throughout the lifecycle of a change




Additional Responsibilities




Develop, maintain, and communicate processes and standard practices related to the design, development, and implementation of application solutions on a project basis

Develop, maintain, and communicate Obsolescence Risk Management process and standard practices to keep a clear view of the system software support roadmaps and the impact on the applications across the enterprise. 

Participate in tier 3 application support activities including incident management and the assessment and delivery of application upgrades and patches

Analyze and estimate feasibility, costs, time, and resources needed to develop and implement solutions (high level)

In collaboration with the Enterprise Architect and the Architecture COE, research and evaluate software technology, products, and solutions, and make recommendations on technology/production introduction, phase-out and retirement

Assist in application portfolio management, standards development, maintenance and governance

Work across the CPGC to understand and leverage common solution components where appropriate



What skills do you need for this role to be yours?



Client Management: can consolidate business requirements and translate them into solution architecture

Architecture design: experienced in several technology architecture design or re-design efforts

Solution design: familiar with workflow concepts and how they integrate with application solutions in a cross applications context

Value Management: can identify the effectiveness and completeness of business and technology strategies and ensure alignment with clients and other applicable cross-organization strategies

Domain knowledge: experience in relevant IT domain and business domain

Minimum of 3 or more years' experience as a Solution Integration Architect or equivalent role at a major company

Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Solution, Business, or Data Architect.

Minimum 10 years’ experience in progressively advancing roles within IT.




Additional Skills That Set You Apart




A mature perspective on architecture and its role in a dynamic company

Broad knowledge of existing technologies and interest in emerging trends and innovations

Exceptional interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation



Education



Academic: undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, business, or equivalent (required), Graduate degree in Business Administration (MBA)(Asset)



Competencies


Be Courageous

Innovate

Be Inclusive

Inspire

Be Curious

Technical Knowledge

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Description




Wavicle Data Solutions
 designs and delivers data and analytics solutions to reduce time, cost, and risk of companies’ data projects, improving the quality of their analytics and decisions now and into the future
. 
As a privately-held consulting service organization with popular, name brand clients across multiple industries, Wavicle offers exciting opportunities for data scientists, solutions architects, developers, and consultants to jump right in and contribute to meaningful, innovative solutions.

Our 300+ local, nearshore and offshore consultants, data architects, cloud engineers, and developers build cost-effective, right-fit solutions leveraging our team’s deep business acumen and knowledge of cutting-edge data and analytics technology and frameworks.



Wavicle Has Been Recognized By Industry Leaders As Follows



At Wavicle, you’ll find a challenging and rewarding work environment where we enjoy working as a team to exceed client expectations. Employees appreciate being part of something meaningful at Wavicle.


Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces

Inc 500 Fastest Growing Private Companies in the US

Crain’s Fast 50 fastest growing companies in the Chicago area

Talend Expert Partner recognition

Microsoft Gold Data Platform competency




Watch here to learn Why Wavicle 


As a 
Machine Learning Architect
, you will be responsible for the end-to-end architecture and development of machine learning solutions that solve some of our client's most complex business problems.



What You Will Get To Do




Lead technical and architectural design discussions, review and guide implementation.

Identify scalable ML solutions to solve business problems that addresses client need.

Understanding on ML pipeline (feature engineering, scoring, signal processing).

Understand Data Engineering and its mechanism, whether its real time or batch. 

Work with Data Scientists on how models are being built and used against different data inputs.

Provide a platform for Data Scientist to access data and processes to allow them to fine tune the models.

Build a system that can provide capabilities for Data Scientists to be contributors.

Leverage cloud compute to build solutions.

Understand Data science needs and translate them into workable solutions.

Mentor and guide other ML engineers, scientists and senior leaders. Be a continuous learner and invest in the learning and development of ML engineers.





Requirements




8+ years of data & analytics professional work experience.

Prior experience working as a management/strategic consultant is highly desirable.

3+ years of architecting, developing and deploying machine learning systems into a production environment.

Experience working with big data tools (i.e. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka , etc.) to extract data.

Familiarity with ML modeling frameworks (i.e. Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch).

Expertise with key Azure services (VM, Storage, Azure SQL, Synapse Cosmos, HDInsights, Azure functions, containers, AKS, ADLS, Events Hub, Azure Databricks, VNet, Redis Cache, Resource Manager, Azure Diagnostics/OMS, Traffic Manager, Azure CDN, Azure Notification Hub, Azure Identity and Access Management, Infrastructure as a Code, etc...).

Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala , etc.

Experience working with distributed systems, service oriented architectures and designing APIs.

Expert knowledge of SQL.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

Familiar with project management methodologies.

Bachelor or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics or related degree.

Hybrid work schedule (onsite/remote). 

Ability to travel to client locations up to 25% (Canadian and U.S. based customers).

Must reside in the Quebec providence; Montreal preferred. Wavicle's Canadian office is located in Montreal. 

Must be authorized as a Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or have an Open Work Permit to be considered for this role.





Equal Opportunity Employer 



Wavicle is an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status.



Benefits




Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)

Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)

Unlimited Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)

Short Term & Long Term Disability

Training & Development

Flexible Work Schedule

Bonus Program

Wellness Program

Soutenir les discussions techniques avec divers groupes de développeurs, de propriétaires de produit et d'expertes du domaine de service de soutien.

Apprendre de nouvelles technologies, cadriciels, outils à code source ouvert et langages de développement.



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



12 ans de mise en œuvre / support de déploiements dans des environnements supérieurs et inférieurs.

6 ans au service de la création d'environnements et de l'administration d'intergiciels

5 ans avec les technologies de virtualisation de tous les fournisseurs

3 ans en tant que concepteur d'architecture de nuage / administrateur d'intergiciels

3 ans avec l'encodage (Batch, Bash, PowerShell, Python, autre)

2 ans en maintenance de nuage, essais, mise en place et service de soutien de la production de multiplateformes

1 an avec la plateforme SAMM Azure, notamment l'image machine, le réseautique, l'équilibrage de la charge, la reprise après sinistre informatique et les composants de mémoire.

1 an d'expérience de l'utilisation de l'interpréteur de ligne de commande Azure, Storage Explorer, générant des signatures d'accès partagé pour les objets Azure Blob.

1 an allocation de ressources / configuration Azure SQL DB, Azure Monitoring, enregistrement d'applications dans Azure AD, zones de système de nom de domaine dans Azure, Azure Key vault

Expérience avec le langage XML et JSON

Connaissances de l'architecture, de la conception et de l'ingénierie système de systèmes d'entreprise utilisant les méthodologies et les cadres de référence d'architecture d'entreprise, d'ITSM, de modulation de phase, d'amélioration des processus et de maturité

« Si vous présentez votre candidature au rôle basé au Québec, vous confirmez que vous parlez couramment la langue française à l'oral et à l'écrit. »



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié



Diplôme de maîtrise en finance, statistiques, mathématiques, ingénierie ou domaines cours STEM connexes

Expérience de travail avec le cadriciel SAFe Agile

Au moins 1 an d'expérience avec le composant intégration d'application Informatica IICS.

Expérience dans la réalisation de projets de services-conseils complexes

Expérience de travail avec des clients gouvernementaux, étatiques / provinciaux et locaux



Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Consulting est l'activité de conseil et de services professionnels mondiaux d'IBM, avec des capacités de pointe dans la transformation des entreprises et des technologies. Avec une expertise approfondie dans de nombreux secteurs, nous offrons des services de stratégie, d'expérience, de technologie et d'exploitation à un grand nombre des entreprises les plus innovantes et les plus précieuses du monde. Nos collaborateurs se concentrent sur l'accélération des activités de nos clients grâce au pouvoir de la collaboration. Nous croyons au pouvoir de la technologie utilisée de manière responsable pour aider les gens, les partenaires et la planète.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Chief Data Office
industries: Accounting
description:
What is the opportunity?

The Senior Business Analyst, Chief Data Office, will support the Senior Project Manager, Enterprise Data Strategy & Governance, with the execution of a data classification and labelling initiative led by the Chief Data Office (CDO), designed to integrate data classification and labeling tools and resources across RBC. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery including planning, elicitation, analysis & documentation management and support for changes to Business Units and Technology. This role requires a basic understanding of data governance principals and experience creating and managing Tableau reporting.

What will you do?


 Prepare requirements for review applying various communication techniques/tools and lead requirements walkthrough and sign off sessions

 Facilitate collaborative requirements sessions with large and diverse groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis and review.

 Apply advanced coverage analysis techniques to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, and testing through to implementation

 Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties

 Develop and manage enterprise level reporting to track to performance and sustainability

 Assess the organizational change impact to people, processes, and systems, and support the integration of these changes into the RBC landscape.

 Provide support/lead for the Senior Project Manager, Enterprise Data Strategy & Governance


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


 3+ years Business Analyst experience dealing with various project management delivery methodologies & tooling (PMF, Waterfall and Agile)

 2+ working with Tableau building out executive reporting to track to initiative rollout & embed and sustain activities

 Proven ability to gather Business and Systems requirements independently, having strong business analysis and systems analysis skills

 Experience in Requirements analysis and quality documentation: Scope Modelling, Business Process Modelling, Use Cases, Data Requirements, Business Rules Analysis, Non Functional Requirements, User Stories, Story Decomposition, and Story Mapping, Acceptance and Evaluation Criteria Definition

 Prior experience with data governance principals & management

 Excellent communication skills required; will be working with BU stakeholders and IT stakeholders

 Proficiency with MS Office (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)


Nice-to-have


 Masters Certificate in Business Analysis

 Experience with business process mapping and development


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

 Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.



Job Summary



City: Toronto

Address: 330 FRONT STREET WEST

Work Hours/Week: 37.5

Work Environment: Office

Employment Type: Full Time

Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional

Application Deadline: 03/15/2022

Platform: Chief Administration Office

Req ID: 455821

About Relogix


Picking your next company is tough. You want to join a team that has proven its potential in the market but hasn't yet grown to the point that you're just another cog in the machine. You want to be heard, learn, and have an impact. That's why it's a perfect time to join Relogix. 




The changing nature of work, employee engagement and how the world of work has changed due to COVID-19 has caused companies to re-evaluate their use of space, its effectiveness and costs is transforming offices everywhere. And now, companies around the world are using our Conexus Workplace Analytics Platform and our advanced IoT sensors to monitor workspace utilization, workplace design effectiveness, and employee engagement as well as inform portfolio optimization and portfolio strategy.




Top corporate real estate organizations depend on our workspace analytics platform and industry expertise to help evolve their global real estate portfolio and create world-class workplace experience with confidence.

 


Scope of the Position


Reporting to the President & COO, the Head of Engineering will be responsible for providing key leadership to a hard-working and very talented development and product management team. This customer-centric, delivery focused individual will put in place effective development processes and procedures to execute effectively and meet the demands of our market. This person will be contribute to technical vision of the product roadmap, product innovation, product design, product development, and influence the product vision.

 

As part of the management team the Head of Engineering will need to clearly communicate the development plan, timelines and deliverables and keep the executives abreast of any change so the company can respond to customers in a timely and proactive manner. This is a person that prides themselves on delivering quality products on time while meeting the expectation of the customers. You will be the member of the management team that cares most about solving the technical challenges and is passionate about digging deep, working hard and achieving award winning results.





Competencies



 



Results Orientation


Focuses strongly on achieving agreed upon outcomes and ensures that key objectives are met within aggressive but achievable timelines; Has a reputation for execution and delivery; Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; Aims to improve upon past performance; Establishes ambitious personal targets and strives to achieve/exceed them.

 


Developing and Coaching Others


Accurately assesses strengths and development needs of employees; Challenges others to improve their abilities and actively supports their development; Continually provides timely and constructive feedback, coaching and challenging learning opportunities; Adjusts coaching style based on each employee's ability and motivation level. Identifies potential career paths and charts a course towards career progression. Holds employees accountable for delivering outcomes and identifies performance plan if required.

 


Problem Solving


Draws parallels across situations and contexts; Divides problems into their individual elements; Develops several explanations or alternatives; Separates the core of a problem from its symptoms and can identify cause and effect.

 


Strategic Approach


Develops a strategic plan to realize the vision; Revises strategy considering changing circumstances; Takes a long-term view of organizational success; Works to clarify long term organizational goals; Able to stand back from immediate problems to focus on more far-reaching ideas.

 


Drive


Adopts an energetic approach; Works towards goals and willingly tackles demanding tasks; Sets the tone of his/her team by demonstrating the capacity for sustained effort and hard work over long periods of time, even in the face of adversity.

 


Information Seeking


Consults widely for business or technical advice, probes for facts and obtains information from a wide variety of sources; Differentiates the critical from the irrelevant or trivial.

 


Responsibilities:



The successful candidate will bring a demonstrated ability to: 


 


Lead a diverse team of software, hardware, test, mobile and data engineers in building and operating our cloud native IoT and analytics platform

Act as the chief architect, owning the overall cloud architecture while mentoring others to take over a growing number of service areas

Operate and pro-actively monitor our entire suite of products, adhering to SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and maintaining a highly secure posture

Interface and collaborate with all business functions, from Product Manager to Sales and other support functions to ensure that the feature set requirements are in line with market expectations and are designed to enhance the customer experience

Prioritize and manage all software development efforts to ensure they are aligned with business objectives to develop and maintain a product requirements/feature backlog

Driving continuous improvement within the software development teams to consistently improve quality, cycle, and deployment time

Assist with client presentations, demonstrations, and technical meetings when required.

Monitor new emerging technologies, execute the technology roadmap based on market demand/constraints

Promote a strong, driven, and dependable team environment through strong leadership and the effective use of hiring, mentoring, coaching, performance management and skills development

Meeting overall schedule and budget committed to in the development plan

A proven track record of managing a complex enterprise data environment architecting and executing data solutions at the enterprise level

Practical experience in the field of data and analytics with a strong business understanding on how to leverage data would be an asset

Translate business needs to technical specification

Encourages and rewards a culture of innovation and continual improvement

Manage SRED and IRAP programs


 


Preferred Experience and Education



The following indicates specific industry, academic and functional experience/qualifications that are important to the successful achievement of the identified responsibilities and performance deliverables.


 


B.S. Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or a technical discipline from an accredited college/University, MBA would be considered an asset

Previous experience in a leadership role of Software Development teams

Previous experience managing high performing customer facing SaaS applications

Deep technical understanding of software development best practices including object-oriented design and development, cloud architecture patterns, infrastructure as code, continuous deployment, automated testing, Domain driven design and Micro-services

Technical understanding of scalable modern cloud-based data platform architectures such as DataBricks/Spark and IoT technologies

Deep understanding and experience with Azure would be an asset.

Ability to build analytical dashboards to monitor product performance using Azure Application Insights or PowerBI would be an asset

Getting the job done right, delivering results, continuously improving, displaying a dynamic approach, displaying energy and enthusiasm

Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate plans, roadmaps, and strategies.

Must be able to demonstrate senior level experience in the architecture, development, release cycle and delivering software products to the enterprise market

Proven success implementing software development methodologies, while establishing and maintaining pragmatic engineering best practices (e.g., code reviews, testing, continuous delivery)

Understanding of budgets and business planning

Have experience working in a startup environment as an early contributor is highly desirable


 


Remuneration and Benefits


Competitive salary, stock options and comprehensive benefits package that includes medical/dental insurance plan.




If you are interested in learning more about this role: please reach out to Catherine Pan at cpan@stonewoodgroupottawa.com 





Relogix is an equal opportunity employer. Should you require any special assistance, please respond to our application confirmation email directly.






On behalf of the entire team at Relogix, we are thrilled with your interest in joining our team. Although we would love to speak to everyone, only those selected will be contacted further.






Please note, in an effort to maintain the safety of our employees, Relogix requires that all employees, including remote workers, who choose to enter the office located at 411 Leggett Drive, provide proof of receipt for the full COVID-19 Vaccination series (or, if not applicable, a letter from a medical practitioner). The administration receipt must be approved by the Government of Canada or the World Health Organization.

Dasro is looking for an Enterprise Architect for a full-time role for one of its clients in Winnipeg, MB (onsite)

 

The Enterprise Architect is responsible for establishing the technology strategy and

roadmap that enables a portfolio to support current and future business capabilities. 

 


Responsibilities include but not limited to:


•        Makes decisions that have a major impact on the Corporation’s ability to attain its strategic directions while maintaining a rationalized portfolio that achieves synergy across the enterprise.

•        Provides direction to work units on what are acceptable tactical objectives and plans how to move from tactical to the strategic architectural objectives.

•        Works closely with leaders of the corporation to modernize and optimize lines of business and address and respond to market disruptors.

•        Responsible for monitoring and adopting technology innovations into the corporation’s technical footprint.

·        The Enterprise Architect needs to keep abreast of technology developments that affect systems, particularly those that are strategic in terms of corporate goals and direction.

·        The position needs to understand how peer companies and agencies are leveraging new technologies, so that the Corporation can be position to be a “fast follower”.

 


Qualifications:


•        Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.

•        SAFe Architect Certification or commitment to complete within 12 months.

•        Seven years of experience in information technology covering a wide range of technologies and disciplines, including:


Five as an architect

Three as a lead architect


•        Experience of business transformation using lean/six sigma principles is an asset.

•        Working knowledge of application development using a variety of technologies including client/server and relational database technology

•        Working knowledge of technology deployment using a variety of technologies including networking and platforms.

•        Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to problem solve and recommend solutions to enhance operations to improve service delivery.

•        Advanced oral and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information in a concise and straightforward manner, including formal presentations for management and technical staff.

•        Interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships with business partners.

•        Working knowledge of project management techniques.

•        Ability to work in an environment that requires multiple on-going activities, which have tight deadlines and a degree of risk.

•        Ability to work effectively in a team environment and provide leadership and influence the performance of others.

•        Ability to solve problems and find creative solutions that meet business needs while maintaining the best interests of the corporation.

•        Intermediate knowledge of applicable software (Microsoft Office, Project, Visio,

•        SQL, and data analysis / management toolsets, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications).

•        Successful candidate must complete SAFe Architect Certification within 12 months and maintain the requirements.

Our multinational investment management client is looking for a Principal Data Management Analyst for their team




This is a full time 18-month contract opportunity with a potential for extension, located in Toronto and will be working hybrid (few days in office and remote)




Responsibilities


Provide support to colleagues in day-to-day operation and production support tasks when call upon

Lead the research and analysis of security master related data in support of the creation/maintenance of Invesco specific data elements

Ensure data provided fits the companies global needs

Represent the team as subject matter experts in cross-functional / global projects

Facilitate discussions to establish consensus and agreement with a win-win focus in mind

Lead, facilitate, coordinate and project manage the research, analysis, implementation, documentation, and training of new business requirements/projects (e.g. new instruments, new/change regulatory requirements, new systems implementation) globally

Establish and continually refine global support model while ensuring unique regional business needs are addressed

Ensure operation procedures are documented, shared with, and cross-train the global team

Perform independent research, review, and analysis of financial statements, organizational structure, business model, operational risks, performances, and securities / financial statements issued by organizations we invest in

Validate and ensure data override requests conform to Data Standard; conduct research/analysis and escalate the issue to appropriate Data Governance bodies as needed

Provide oversight for the standardization, acquisition, maintenance, and quality assurance of data 

Proactively contribute ideas, research and recommend continuous improvement opportunities (e.g. data standard enhancements, streamline/automate daily operations processes)

Lead approved continuous improvement initiatives

Provide oversight to ensure data integrity in systems we support and that data are reconciled across these systems

Serve as a mentor to Analysts and Administrators in the global Data Operations Team

Provide guidance by sharing knowledge and experience with the team

Provide feedback to location managers on the performance of global team members he/she interacts with

Research in new security instruments, lead the creation of support procedures, and train global team

Liaise and build strong business relationships with global colleagues, data vendors (e.g. Bloomberg, Reuters), and application vendors (e.g. Eagle, BlackRock)

Proactively identify potential operational risks, suggest mitigation strategy to the manager and lead the implementation of the agreed-upon mitigation strategy

Act as subject matter expert and the escalation point in production issues

Own critical production issues and ensure these issues are resolved accurately and efficiently





Qualifications


University degree in Accounting, Finance or business area of concentration (or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required)

Minimum 4-6 years' securities industry experience

Knowledge of market data services such as Bloomberg and Reuters is required

Must have previous knowledge and work experience with data management applications (e.g. CADIS, Eagle PACE)

Trading applications (e.g. Charles River, Aladdin)

Portfolio administration applications (e.g. Eagle STAR, Portia, FMC) and fund accounting applications 

Must have a good understanding of the end-to-end investment services processes such as trade entry, trade process, settlement, valuation, corporate action processing and fund account

Must have a strong understanding on the impact of different characteristics of a security has on downstream data consumers and business functions (e.g. Compliance, Risk, Performance)

Must have a big picture view and deep data / process / business flow knowledge across systems GPRS used

Customer focus and with a keen interest in providing superb services to clients

Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal and conflict resolution skills

Experience in communication and facilitation with all levels within a global organization is required

Excellent organization skills, detail oriented, big picture perspective and work under pressure with tight deadline

Excellent research & analytical as well as problem solving skills

Self-managing and proactively prioritize his/her work as well as team tasks

Maintain a global focus and have strong connection with all levels of colleagues in a cross-functional global team environment

Strong Microsoft Office skills – in particular Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Project and Vision

Numerate and analytical

Ability to mentor and lead a global project team that is not his/her direct reports

Strong facilitation, project management and presentation skills

Is open-minded and a strong "out-of-the-box" thinker who challenges status-quo

An excellent listener with superb facilitation skills

Ability to understand technical details of system and data flow; and communicate/present technical concepts to business colleagues

MBA an asset

Certify Financial Analyst (CFA) or Professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CA, CPA) an asset

Working Conditions: 

Participate in Business Recovery testing on an as-needed basis as defined by manager  

Overtime, off-hours support and travel may be required

job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Part-Time, Bloom Institute of Technology (BloomTech) (Remote) - $30,000/year USD
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Bloom Institute of Technology (BloomTech). Have you got what it takes?

Are you an expert data scientist - the person your peers come to with questions? Do you want to build a personal brand as subject-matter expert, but aren’t sure how? Here’s your chance! Teach a new generation of data scientists & analysts your world-class skills, without giving up your day job.

Bloom Institute of Technology (BloomTech) is looking for part-time Data Science professionals to teach in an immersive, live, online classroom. You will set your own schedule, choosing the weekly classes that work for your life.

You will impart the technical and soft skills that made your own career successful. BloomTech is committed to the success of our students, to the extent that they don’t pay tuition until they secure a job. This unparalleled commitment to employability requires the best instructors to prepare them.

BloomTech is committed to building a diverse team of staff and instructors where everyone feels seen, heard, and valued. Therefore, we welcome a diverse pool of applicants, including those from historically marginalized groups and non-traditional backgrounds who can appreciate the diverse student communities we serve.

If you’re passionate about Data Science and ready to share your top-notch skills, apply today!



What You Will Be Doing




Teaching daily live code-alongs via Zoom, explaining complex concepts simply, using real-life examples, exercises, and storytelling

Providing learner support, encouraging struggling learners and challenging those who are excelling

Providing curriculum feedback and reporting learner progress




What You Won’t Be Doing




Managing other instructors or teaching assistants

Merely tutoring students - your professional expertise forms the foundation of teaching the technical skills required for success in the real world.

Traveling for conferences, meetings, or trainings. We are a 100% remote team.




Senior Data Scientist Key Responsibilities



Pass on your technical expertise to build data scientists & analysts ready to start new careers.



Basic Requirements




Demonstrable expertise in Python programming, related Python libraries (pandas, numpy)

Proficient in using machine learning libraries to build statistical models (e.g. scikit-learn, statsmodels, etc.) and data visualization techniques and tools (e.g. matplotlib, bokeh, etc.)

3+ years in a data science role

No teaching experience required!




About Bloom Institute Of Technology (BloomTech)



Bloom Institute of Technology (BloomTech) is pioneering a new model of accessible higher education with no upfront costs and where the school invests in the students instead of the other way around. We offer an intensive program and an immersive live, online curriculum that teaches people the hard and soft skills they need to launch a new tech career.

Our success depends on building teams who can challenge each other's assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we don't just accept differences – we celebrate them. BloomTech welcomes a diverse pool of applicants, including those from historically marginalized groups and non-traditional backgrounds who can appreciate the diverse student communities that we serve.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!


Working with Crossover


This is a part-time (20 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $30,000 USD/year assuming 20 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.


What to expect next:



You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.

Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.



Important!
 If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.

Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/reset-password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4695-CA-Toronto-SeniorDataScie.004

job_title: Senior Data Developer - Client Performance & Reporting
industries: Accounting
description:
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

Deliver data solutions that provide client insights across Banking and Global Market. The role will focus on data tasks that include data transformation, data management, data modeling and data analysis to produce these insights. The candidate is expected to implement and exhibit excellent agile practices & leadership qualities to ensure the strategic direction for our delivery of a scalable data platform. The role will coordinate, develop, lead, communicate and execute activities to ensure objectives are accomplished according on time.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?


 The candidate will be responsible for the long term strategic modernization of Client Portal data infrastructure and alignment to Data Fabric in accordance to the CM Data Strategy, and building scalable solutions leveraging Micro services, Containerization, Orchestration and Dev-ops practices

 Delivers results in a high demand, multiple deadline environment

 Communicate effectively with developers, system analysts, senior management, project sponsors and business users.

 Drives issue resolution, challenges the team to overcome obstacles at the project/program level

 Provide technical expertise throughout the product life cycle including design, implementation, and delivery of scalable build/test/release infrastructure, as well as technical leadership by closely monitoring applications to ensure alignment with data best practices

 Summarizes and highlights important developments, drives discussion on project impact

 Influences and mentors colleagues within and outside immediate team

 Work in collaboration with Data Fabric teams to implement suitable solutions to improve controls of our data, ensuring data solutions are accurate, complete, and timely


WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?



Must Have




 Minimum 5 to 7 years working in Capital Markets focused on data analysis and client insights

 Hands on experience with, but not limited to, ETL, SQL development and performance optimization, SSIS/SSRS/SSAS

 Working knowledge of big data technologies - Hadoop (Hive, Dremio), no-SQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark, Python, Cloud technologies and Containerization

 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related major.

 Energetic - Willing to work hard and drive initiatives to success.




Nice-to-have




 Need strong understanding of all lines of Capital Markets business to deliver a cohesive technical solution towards our overall business strategy.

 Provide technical expertise in large scale projects in Capital Markets technology in Canada.

 To be viewed as the go-to person for technical matters and be perceived as a partner for the business, rather than a task-taker. The incumbent has to exercise sound judgment to deal with the road blocks during project implementation, architecture design while balancing both our short term and long terms interests and solution feasibility


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 A world-class training program in financial services

 Flexible work/life balance options

 Opportunities to do challenging work
